related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* @ekuznetsov139 reports an issue where Pieces fails to install Ollama while claiming curl is missing.
* Ollama installation is attempted when the program is used.
* The problem lies in Pieces-OS being installed as a snap with limited access to resources outside its sandbox.

**Problems:**

* Ollama installation fails due to Pieces-OS's sandboxed environment.
* Users are required to install curl and Ollama manually.

**Solutions:**

* Allow access to curl and Ollama within the Pieces-OS snap.
* Update the snap definition to include necessary dependencies.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A fix is in progress and will be released soon.
* The issue is still present in the latest version of Pieces-OS.

**Additional Information:**

* Related issues include #527, #442, and #393.
* Helpful resources include Existing Issues, Documentation, and the YouTube Channel.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance and Usability Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, errors with specific language models, and UI/UX problems like large font size. Solutions include switching language models, optimizing memory, and troubleshooting with developers. Some issues persist despite updates and workarounds.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

### Key points raised:

* Users are experiencing high memory and CPU usage with PiecesOS, particularly when using Live Context.
* This issue affects both CPU and GPU LLM instances.
* Some users have reported PiecesOS consuming up to 5GB of RAM and 50% of CPU, making their systems slow and unusable.

### Problems identified:

* High memory usage, especially when using Live Context.
* High CPU usage, leading to slow system performance.
* Users suspecting mining activity due to the high resource usage.

### Solutions proposed/implemented:

* The developers acknowledge the memory leak issue and are working on a fix.
* They recommend users with high memory usage to schedule a call with them for troubleshooting.
* An "Optimize Memory" option is available in the Pieces toolbar/taskbar.
* Disabling Live Context can help reduce memory usage.

### Current status/outcome:

* The developers are actively working on improving the memory and CPU efficiency of PiecesOS.
* Some users have reported improvement with the "Optimize Memory" option and disabling Live Context.
* However, the issue persists for some users, causing significant performance issues.

## Additional notes:

* The issue is ongoing as of January 26, 2025.
* Users are frustrated with the high resource usage, which is hindering their productivity.
* The developers are committed to resolving the issue and improving the overall performance of PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Pieces Qdrant Server pop up in Pieces OS 8.0.0 Windows
related_issues.text:
ANNOUNCEMENT: Pieces Qdrant Server pop up in Pieces OS 8.0.0 Windows
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

8.0.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Windows users please be aware that with the release of Pieces OS v8.0.0, upon loading the desktop application the first time you may receive the following dialog box:

![image (8)](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/152189388/bd326c95-752d-435f-88d2-9da46d88c46a)

This is a standalone executable that we need to run in order to enable our new long-term memory and other enhancements to the copilot chat experience. This dialog box is expected and in order to receive this new functionality you will need to choose "Allow access." If you deny it, you will likely have a degraded chat experience and it may cause breakages in the app down the line. 

Apologies for the inconvenience; we will work on making this a better user experience going forward.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:** The documentation for installing PiecesOS on Windows is missing information about qdrant.

**Problem Identified:** @jimbobbennett reported that the Windows install docs do not mention qdrant, which could be confusing for users.

**Proposed Solution:** @judson-at-pieces initially proposed adding the information to the existing documentation. However, @mark-at-pieces pointed out that qdrant will be deprecated with the next PiecesOS release, making the issue irrelevant.

**Current Status/Outcome:** The issue will be closed as it's no longer relevant due to the upcoming qdrant deprecation. The documentation will likely be updated to reflect this change in the future.
